title: Work Like Individual Contributors Transformation
summary: CEO Nadella restructured executives to act as ICs, becoming hands-on product leader during AI transition

content.whatItIs: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has executed one of the most dramatic organizational transformations in big tech: restructuring executive ranks while demanding that all leaders 'work and act like Individual Contributors in our own orgs, constantly learning and unlearning.'
howItWorks: December 2025: Major executive restructuring, appointed Judson Althoff as CEO of commercial business to free Nadella's time for hands-on technical work
Nadella became 'deeply hands-on with the company's AI push, actively engaging with top engineers and closely reviewing product performance'
Runs intensive weekly meetings, issues direct product mandates, personally courts elite researchers from OpenAI and Google DeepMind
Pressuring executives to 'work faster and leaner'—company must 'move with greater speed, rethink entrenched practices'
Philosophy: 'Think in decades, execute in quarters'—long-term conviction with operational intensity
content.coreInsight: At moments of technological discontinuity, CEOs must become hands-on product leaders, not just strategists. Flatten hierarchies, demand IC-level engagement from executives, and create organizational urgency that treats the status quo as the risk.
content.keyMetrics: FY2025: ~$80B spent on AI-enabled datacenters. 400+ data centers in 70 regions including 'world's most powerful AI data centre' in Fairwater.
